results.name: Number of cyclic arrangements of S={2,3,...,n+1} such that the difference of any two neighbors is greater than 1, and a divisor of their sum.
comment: a(n)=NPC(n;S;P) is the count of all neighbor-property cycles for a specific set S of n elements and a specific pair-property P. For more details, see the link and A242519.
For this property P and sets {0,1,2,...,n-1} or {1,2,...,n} the problem does not appear to have any solution.
link: S. Sykora, On Neighbor-Property Cycles, Stan's Library, Volume V, 2014.
example: The shortest such cycle is of length n=9: {2,4,8,10,5,7,9,3,6}.
The next a(n)>0 occurs for n=14 and has 20 solutions.
